question1.question:
An Einstein Analytics consultant needs to show total values of all cases by case status, grouped by month/year the case was created.
Which chart would effectively achieve this business requirement?
question1.option1textexplanation: Incorrect. Use a pie chart when you have multiple groupings and want to show the proportion of a single value for each grouping against the total.
question1.option2text: Line chart for each status value
question1.option2textexplanation: Incorrect. Use a line chart when you have one important grouping representing an ordered set of data and one value to show.
question1.option3textexplanation: Incorrect. Use a funnel chart when you have multiple groupings in an ordered set and want to show the proportions among them.
question1.option4text: Stacked bar chart or stacked column chart
question1.option4textexplanation: Correct. Use the bar or column chart to provide a quick visual comparison of related values.

question2.accessibility: Question 2. This question has 4 possible answer(s) to chose from. The question has 1 correct answer(s).
question2.question: What is an advantage of using Analytics templated apps?
question2.option1text: When creating an app from a template, it automatically creates datasets and dashboards, speeding your organization’s time to value.
question2.option1textexplanation: Correct. Analytics templated apps and prebuilt Analytics apps from Salesforce speed your organization’s time-to-value with Analytics.
question2.option2text: When creating an app from a template, the template automatically creates the users, profiles, and permission sets needed to execute the application, so that the user can start building their dashboards.
question2.option2textexplanation: Incorrect. Einstein Analytics does not create users, profiles, or permission sets.
question2.option3text: When creating an app from a template, Analytics automatically creates recipes for lenses and datasets in the application.
question2.option3textexplanation: Incorrect. Einstein Analytics templates do not automatically create recipes between datasets.
question2.option4text: When creating an app from a template, Analytics automatically creates the flows needed.
question2.option4textexplanation: Incorrect. Einstein Analytics does not create flows in your org.

question3.question: What is a requirement when using an Approval Analytics Template?
question3.option1text: The user needs to have View All Data access as well as the right licenses to use this template.
question3.option1textexplanation: Incorrect. This gives the user more visibility than required.
question3.option2text: Make sure all app users, including the Analytics Integration User, have the Einstein Analytics license
question3.option2textexplanation: Incorrect. Ensuring users have the correct license assigned does not complete all of the requirements to utilize Approval Analytics templates.
question3.option3text: The org needs to have a defined approval process and at least one object with a record submitted for approval, and users need the right licenses.
question3.option3textexplanation: Correct. All users need the appropriate analytics user licenses; the org must have a defined approval process; and the field-level security must be set for the Analytics Integration User to see all fields used in the app.
question3.option4text: The org needs to have sharing rules defined for the data that will be processed by the application.
question3.option4textexplanation: Incorrect. Defining sharing rules does not complete all of the requirements to utilize Approval Analytics templates.
